titleStmt.title: World Wide Diplomatic Archives Index: Malawi
Malawi

div.head: Legislation
div.p: The National Archives Act of 1990 stipulates that access to the content of the archives can only be achieved with the permission of the Head Archivist. Essentially, documents are available after 40 years with the approval of the creating Ministry.

div.head: Location
div.p: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, P.O. Box 30315, Capital City, Lilongwe 3. The Deputy Director of Culture, National Archives of Malawi, Mkulichi Road, P.O. Box 62, Zomba.

div.head: Procedures
div.p: Researchers should apply to the National Archives with a detailed request for access to its records. This can be done at the Archives. There are no restrictions on accessing the finding aids found in the Search Room. If permission is granted, there is a fee to view the Archives’ records.
